editorialSummary.text: 19th-century brownstone with fireplaces, parquet floors & some antique furnishings, plus free Wi-Fi.

originalText.text: i loved it. The area is wonderful - the real New York but still has all the restaurants and shopping you could need. great connections on the bus and central park a moment away. the best is the room. absolutely huge with an amazing bathroom. feels like a 1000 usd a night suite. impeccably cleaned each day. its quiet elegant and it is a real find

originalText.text: I absolutely loved Mount Morris house - it is a haven of peace, elegance and antiquity. It is a home, a luxurious, otherworldly one, and not simply a guest house. Peter is a fabulous host and cannot do enough to make the stay comfortable and memorable.  Spacious rooms, beautiful decorated, with fine furniture, comfortable bed, fantastic shower, home-baked cookies.

originalText.text:
We stayed in honeymoon.
Our room was perfect cleaned, and also shower room is very clean.
The furnitures looks beautiful.

We past in the good time.
Thank you for everything.

originalText.text:
What a pleasure it was to stay at Mount Morris House! Perfectly situated in Harlem, a little 15 minutes walk to Central Park, museums very quickly accessible and direct metro to wherever you want in NYC.
And when you are tired of visiting you can enjoy and rest in this beautiful 19th century house perfectly renovated by Peter, Vasili and Dimitri with Asian, Persian and European antiques and paintings all over the place. Along with peaceful jazz music and fresh flowers, it is always calm and relaxing after walking all day long in the city. And I didn’t even mention the cakes (blueberry, my favorite) and cookies baked everyday by Peter for all guests.
In summary, thank you Peter for all these attentions and for the pleasure you have talking and sharing about your house and your city. We had a wonderful time in Mount Morris and we sincerely hope we can meet again, in NYC or in France.

In summary, thank you Peter for all these attentions and for the pleasure you have talking and sharing about your house and your city. We had a wonderful time in Mount Morris and we sincerely hope we can meet again, in NYC or in France.

originalText.text:
Mount Morris House, a private brownstone residence in Harlem, was an absolute delight.  Going through the front door was like stepping into a tranquil museum, with art pieces from all around the world.  Elegant and eclectically decorated with perfect composition, perfectly clean--not a single cobweb, gentle jazz music playing...  I could go on and on.  My room was enormous, with a beautiful and comfortable four-poster bed, lovely carpets, a huge and glorious bathtub, tall ceilings--it was like stepping back in history, down to the lovely fireplace and decorative doorknobs.  There were a great variety of teas (and other hot beverages) available in the kitchen, as well as fresh fruit, homemade cookies and cakes, instant oatmeal, and many candies and snacks.  I was sorry not to have been able to meet the owner and get a tour of the art collection, but he was very kind and gracious over the phone when we spoke.
This is not an affluent part of New York City, but everyone was very kind to me as I walked to and from the residence.  There are subway stops and a train stop within walking distance, and Central Park is less than a mile's walk away.  It was fun to meet some of the other guests, many of whom were from other parts of the world.  I DEFINITELY will stay again if I have the opportunity.
